scenarios.title: Cultural Sensitivity
scenarios.narrator: You find yourself in a culturally diverse setting and want to ensure that you interact respectfully and sensitively with everyone. Understanding cultural differences is key to fostering positive interactions.

questions.text: You are at a dinner party with people from various cultural backgrounds. How do you make sure your conversation is inclusive?

options.text: Ask open-ended questions about their cultures and listen actively.
options.feedback: Asking open-ended questions and listening actively shows respect and interest in their backgrounds.

options.text: Avoid talking about cultural differences altogether.
options.feedback: Avoiding cultural differences can make the conversation seem superficial and disinterested.

options.text: Make jokes about cultural stereotypes to break the ice.
options.feedback: Making jokes about cultural stereotypes is disrespectful and can be offensive.

options.text: Dominate the conversation with your own cultural experiences.
options.feedback: Dominating the conversation with your own experiences can come off as self-centered and dismissive.

questions.text: During a conversation, someone shares a cultural practice that is unfamiliar to you. How do you respond?

options.text: Express curiosity and ask them to tell you more about it.
options.feedback: Expressing curiosity and asking for more information shows respect and a willingness to learn.

options.text: Laugh and say it's strange.
options.feedback: Laughing and calling it strange is disrespectful and dismissive.

options.text: Ignore it and change the subject.
options.feedback: Ignoring it can make the person feel unvalued and unheard.

options.text: Tell them that it doesn't make sense to you.
options.feedback: Telling them it doesn't make sense can come off as judgmental and closed-minded.

questions.narrator: You notice that some people are not participating in a group activity, possibly due to cultural differences.

options.text: Respect their choice and offer alternative ways for them to engage if they want to.
options.feedback: Respecting their choice and offering alternatives shows cultural sensitivity and inclusiveness.

options.text: Insist that they join in to be part of the group.
options.feedback: Insisting they join can be seen as disrespectful and forceful.

options.text: Ignore them and continue with the activity.
options.feedback: Ignoring them can make them feel excluded and unvalued.

options.text: Point out their lack of participation to the group.
options.feedback: Pointing out their lack of participation can embarrass them and make the situation worse.

questions.narrator: Someone uses a term you find culturally insensitive.
questions.text: What is the best way to handle this situation?

options.text: Privately explain why the term is insensitive and suggest a better alternative.
options.feedback: Privately explaining and suggesting an alternative shows respect and helps educate them without causing embarrassment.

options.text: Publicly call them out to show your disapproval.
options.feedback: Publicly calling them out can create defensiveness and hostility.

options.text: Ignore it and let it slide.
options.feedback: Ignoring it can perpetuate insensitivity and fail to address the issue.

options.text: Laugh along to avoid making things awkward.
options.feedback: Laughing along can seem like you are endorsing the insensitive term.

questions.narrator: You want to show respect for cultural practices that are different from your own.
questions.text: What is a good approach to take?

options.text: Learn about the practices in advance and participate respectfully.
options.feedback: Learning and participating respectfully shows that you value and respect their cultural practices.

options.text: Avoid participating to avoid doing something wrong.
options.feedback: Avoiding participation can seem like disinterest and a lack of respect.

options.text: Critique the practices to show your own perspective.
options.feedback: Critiquing the practices can be seen as disrespectful and dismissive.

options.text: Make jokes about the differences to lighten the mood.
options.feedback: Making jokes can be offensive and disrespectful.
